formatDescription: The Open Media Framework Interchange (OMF Interchange) is a standard format for the interchange of digital media, designed to allow interchange between software applications and platforms. The format includes rules for identifying the original sources of the digital media data, and it can encapsulate both compressed and uncompressed digital media data.
provenanceCompoundName: Brigham Young University / Brigham Young University

internalSignatures.name: Open Media Framework Interchange 1.0 (sig 1)
internalSignatures.note: OMF files contain headers version 1.0 'OMFI:ObjID ', which are variable within the file. The choice to use data from near EOF allows for identification. Version is based on endian, so two bytes are used.

internalSignatures.name: Open Media Framework Interchange 1.0 (sig 2)
internalSignatures.note: OMF files contain headers version 1.0 'OMFI:ObjID ', which are variable within the file. The choice to use data from near EOF allows for identification. Version is based on endian, so two bytes are used.
